name: Pork and Fennel Sausage Rolls
keywords: Pork and Fennel Sausage Rolls, Homemade Sausage Rolls, Pork Sausage Rolls, Pork Mince Recipe, Savoury Pastry, Appetizer, Snack, Main Course, British Cuisine, Australian Cuisine, Party Food, Comfort Food, Easy Recipe, Flaky Pastry, Baking, Oven-baked, Pork, Bacon, Fennel, Panko, Puff Pastry, Parsley, Carrot, Onion
description: A delicious and savoury recipe for homemade Pork and Fennel Sausage Rolls. This dish features a flavourful filling of pork mince, streaky bacon, carrot, and onion, seasoned with aromatic fennel seeds and fresh parsley, all wrapped in flaky, golden-brown puff pastry.

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat oven to 180C. Finely dice bacon and start frying over a medium heat in a medium sized pan.
recipeInstructions.name: Prep bacon

recipeInstructions.text: Mince the carrot, onion and garlic. Add to the bacon with the fennel seeds and slowly cook to get rid of some of the moisture.
recipeInstructions.name: Prep veg mix

recipeInstructions.text: Let the bacon and veg mix cool, finely mince the parsley, then mix everything except 1 egg and the pastry.
recipeInstructions.name: Mix sausage filling

recipeInstructions.text: Slice pastry sheets in half, and 1/4 of the filling and roll up.
recipeInstructions.name: Roll the rolls

recipeInstructions.text: Transfer to a tray lined with baking paper. Whisk the remaining egg and brush over the top. Sprinkle some extra fennel seeds over the top.
recipeInstructions.name: Brush the rolls

recipeInstructions.text: Bake at 180C for 30m or until golden and cooked through. Enjoy with your choice of sauces!
recipeInstructions.name: Bake and Serve!

notes: Puff pastry sheets I use are about 26cm x 26cm.
Add 2 tbsp of berbere for an amazing spiced version of already fantastic sausage rolls.
Goes great with kasundi, ketchup, aioli, mayo, chipotle mayo and more.
If you like soggier bottoms don't fry the onion and carrot. They'll then release their juices as the rolls cook.
